title: How to Play Need for Speed Most Wanted on PS2

steps.headline: Do a perfect launch.
steps.description:
Watch your tachometer when at the starting line. Get your needle in the blue right when the race starts to get a perfect launch and gain some time against your opponents. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d3\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/d\/d3\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/aid261622-v4-728px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"545","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: One Stop Shop Marker
steps.description:
Press Up, Up, Down, Down, Left, Right, Up, Down at the "Press Start" screen. A special marker for the Junkman Engine part will appear in the back room of the One Stop Shop in career mode. This code can only be enabled once per career. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a0\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/a\/a0\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/aid261622-v4-728px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"545","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Cheat Mode > Enter at the start screen.
Quick start
steps.description:
Pay close attention to your tachometer when launching from the start line. Grab a perfect launch to gain a few precious seconds. When the needle turns blue drop the clutch and hold on. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/98\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/9\/98\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/aid261622-v4-728px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Perfect Launch
steps.description:
Watch your tachometer when at the starting line. Get your needle in the blue right when the race starts to get a perfect launch and gain some time against your opponents. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/ec\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/e\/ec\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/aid261622-v4-728px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Mo' Money
steps.description:
When you're going to sell a car, always take it to the tune up shop and sell all the parts first. The selling price of the car is the same either way. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1a\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/1\/1a\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/aid261622-v4-728px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Extra Money
steps.description:
If you start a new career with a memory card with Need for Speed Underground 2 file on it you get extra money when starting out. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1b\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/1\/1b\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/aid261622-v4-728px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Recommended car tuning
steps.description:
If you are performance tuning your car, try to raise "Top Speed", "Acceleration", and "Handling" at the same time, and keep them even as much as possible. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/91\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-3Bullet5.jpg\/v4-460px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-3Bullet5.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/9\/91\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-3Bullet5.jpg\/aid261622-v4-728px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-3Bullet5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Easy Money when You Sell a Car
steps.description:
Before you sell a car, go to a One-Stop Shop and reset all the exterior body parts (body kit, wheels, spoiler, hood, etc.) to stock. You will get a trade-in credit for the old custom parts and it will not lower the car's value when you sell it in the Safe House. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1a\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/1\/1a\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/aid261622-v4-728px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Additional cars.
Easy money
steps.description:
If you are low on cash, just defeat one of the opponents on the black-list. You will get two marks to use on several different things. Do not use them on the Uniques early in the game. Instead, use them on the middle or the left "Random" choices. They should always come out to either be a big cash bonus or the opponent's pink slip. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/27\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-11Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/2\/27\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-11Bullet1.jpg\/aid261622-v4-728px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Skip police chase after a maximum possibility police encounter race
steps.description:
When you race any race that has maximum potential for police encounter, a police chase will ensue sometime during the race. After the race you will need to get away from them so that the win and money won will stay. To completely skip this sometimes tedious process after a race, wait until you see the "auto-save" icon at the top of the screen disappear. Once it has disappeared (completed auto-save), hit reset and reload your profile. The race will show complete along with the money credits in your bank account. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bb\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-12Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-12Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/b\/bb\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-12Bullet1.jpg\/aid261622-v4-728px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-12Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"545","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Get an extra $10,000.
steps.description:
To get an extra $10,000 in career mode, have a Need For Speed Underground career game saved on your hard drive. After the prologue you will get $10,000. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/53\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-13Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-13Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/5\/53\/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-13Bullet1.jpg\/aid261622-v4-728px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-13Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"545","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

"} Easy money If you are low on cash, just defeat one of the opponents on the black-list. You will get two marks to use on several different things. Do not use them on the Uniques early in the game. Instead, use them on the middle or the left "Random" choices. They should always come out to either be a big cash bonus or the opponent's pink slip. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/27/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-11Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/2/27/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-11Bullet1.jpg/aid261622-v4-728px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Skip police chase after a maximum possibility police encounter race When you race any race that has maximum potential for police encounter, a police chase will ensue sometime during the race. After the race you will need to get away from them so that the win and money won will stay. To completely skip this sometimes tedious process after a race, wait until you see the "auto-save" icon at the top of the screen disappear. Once it has disappeared (completed auto-save), hit reset and reload your profile. The race will show complete along with the money credits in your bank account. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bb/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-12Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-12Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/b/bb/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-12Bullet1.jpg/aid261622-v4-728px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-12Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"545","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Get an extra $10,000. To get an extra $10,000 in career mode, have a Need For Speed Underground career game saved on your hard drive. After the prologue you will get $10,000. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/53/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-13Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-13Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/5/53/Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-13Bullet1.jpg/aid261622-v4-728px-Play-Need-for-Speed-Most-Wanted-on-PS2-Step-13Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"545","licensing":"
